page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There are{no factories or offices}in Fishbourne. Most people have to{travel into{Chichester,Portsmouth}or even {London}to{work.}The only places providing employment in Fishbourne are the rest homes,pubs,or small village stores/postoffices and farms.Most fathers are either{professionals}or work as management{executives.}Most mothers work{locally}(Chichester), as housewives,or both. In the past most villagers were employed locally on the farms,in mainly unskilled jobs. Although the land is still used for {agriculture,}the use has changed to mainly{cereal and grass}crops,with very few people employed.The oldest family in the school,the Scarterfields ,owns Leggatts Farm,growing barley to feed their pigs.
